Empath::

The femme shudders as she finally breaks the contact.  "I've never 
done that before," she admits, "not even with Skywarp.  I never felt 
safe opening my own mind to anyone else - it makes me vulnerable.  
Whether you realized it or not at the time, you could have trapped me 
under your direct control forever."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airshadow Nightstar" <airly2002@h...> 
wrote:
> Windlord::
> 
> Windlord Opened his mind and he could feel the pain and sorrow the 
EMphath 
> felt. He could understand all, after he saw all her life.
> 
> "Empath" thought Windlord while the compassion and his love 
arrose "How did 
> you suffer, my dear Empath..."
> 
> 
> >From: "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...>
> >Empath::
> >
> >The most direct route has usually worked best for Empath.  She 
turns
> >toward Windlord and gently places her hands on either side of his
> >head.  "It's easier to show you than tell you," she says.  "Try to
> >relax - I won't hurt you."
> >
> >She reaches out with her mind, drawing Windlord's feelings for her 
to
> >the surface.  Empath's gratified to learn that her initial 
assessment
> >was correct, but she's not done.  Briefly, she opens her own mind 
to
> >the Maximal, allowing him to see all she's seen - from her creation
> >millions of years ago, through the Great War, to the pain of losing
> >Skywarp to Galvatron's selfish machinations.  She shows him the
> >reformatting, when she became a predacon trapped under Galvatron's
> >control; finding the Soul Orb and accidentally freeing herself; and
> >finally, she shows the recent events that have drawn them to this
> >moment - and the fact that her own emotions mirror his.
